page.title: 01BRIEF OUTLINE
page.content: The area contains 2 Villages, one called Bilsthorpe which is a Mining community with houses, shops, schools, some light industry and a large number of Clubs and organisations. It is passed to the West by the Nottingham Road and to the south by the Mansfield to Newark Road. A Landfill and Landscaping scheme is in progress to the east of the village. Eakring is the other village, it is situated on the top of a hill surrounded by farmland and woodland. The friendly small rural community has one shop,a bus service and Clubs catering for most age groups. There are some special conservation factors. However, Eakring was the first place in the country where oil was produced, British petroleum still have their Main Development base here.
